columns.text: In this problem, we need to determine whether the company's inventory policy is optimal.
A company begins each week with $3,400$ switch assemblies. The carrying cost per switch assembly is $\$347.45$ per year and the fixed order cost is $\$1,100$.

Since uses $3,400$ switch assemblies per week, the average inventory  is $\frac{3,400}{2}=1,700$ units. The carrying cost per switch assembly is $\$7.45$, so 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Total carrying costs}&=\text{Average inventory}\cdot \text{Carrying cost per unit}\\
&=1,700\cdot \$7.45\\
&=\$12,665\\
\end{align*}$$

The company orders assemblies every week, and the year has $52$ weeks, so the total number of its orders during the year is equal to $52$. Company has the fixed cost per order of $\$1,100$, so, the total restocking cost for the year are 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Total restocking cost}&=\text{Fixed cost per order}\cdot\text{Number of orders}\\
&=\$1,100\cdot 52\\
&=\$57,200
\end{align*}$$

So, the total costs for the company are 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Total costs}& = \text{Total carrying costs} + \text{Total restocking costs}\\
&=\$12,665+\$57,200\\
&=\$69,865
\end{align*}$$

An optimal inventory policy for the company is 
$$\begin{align*}
EOQ&=\sqrt{\frac{2\cdot \text{Annual Demand}\cdot \text{Fixed Cost to Purchase}}{\text{Carring Cost per unit}}}\\
&=\sqrt{\frac{2\cdot (52\cdot 3,400)\cdot\$1,100}{\$7,45}}\\
&=\sqrt{\frac{\$388,960,000}{\$7.45}}\\
&=\sqrt{52,209,395.97}\\
&\approx7,225.61\\
\end{align*}$$

For Provenza Manufacturing, the economic order quantity is $7,225.61$ switch assemblies.
